title: Ticket #605: Claim activation failure due to shadow/startd communication issue
description:
NOTE: Details, logs, and Todd's initial response in the associated RUST email. 

   $CondorVersion: 7.0.5 Sep 20 2008 BuildID: 105846 $
   $CondorPlatform: INTEL-WINNT50 $

The problem is that on many jobs (definitely over half if not almost all) the startd and the shadow fail to connect properly resulting in the job being evicted and the shadow exiting with status 108. You can see the behavior in the attached SchedLog, ShadowLog, and StartdLog files.

You can see the scheduler start up the shadow for that job and match it to a slot2 on the execute node. And you can see the shadow and startd talking. But it appears that there is a communication issue - possibly security related - that causes the shadow to think it hasn't heard from the startd and to then evict the job.
